meanings.sent1: The disgruntled customer complained about the poor service.
meanings.sent2: She looked disgruntled after receiving a cold meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The disgruntled cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The disgruntled clouds darkened the sky, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His disgruntled expression spoke volumes about his dissatisfaction.

meanings.sent1: The long wait in line disgruntled the customers.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to disgruntle her team by changing the project last minute.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to turn water into soda only managed to disgruntle the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected delay in the train schedule disgruntled the commuters.
meanings.sent5: His decision to cancel the event disgruntled many attendees.
